column4: gday, could anyone tell me wether its possible to boot ubuntu at a certain time (by cron i.e.)
if ubuntu is off, it is off, there is no way to run ANY computer with any system while its off

you have to understand that once a computer is turned off it has no control over an operating system (such as ubuntu) the system is turned to BIOS, and unless your bios supports some sort of timer to turn on (unless its wake on lan) it cannot be done from the operating system level
also if windows does it then it must use wake on lan
